# List of awards and nominations received by Yoasobi

}}
Japanese duo Yoasobi has received numerous accolades, including ten Japan Gold Disc Awards, five CD Shop Awards, four MTV Video Music Awards Japan, three Music Awards Japan, three Reiwa Anisong Awards, three Space Shower Music Awards, two Japan Record Awards, one Noma Publishing Culture Award, one Crunchyroll Anime Award, and one Melon Music Award, among others.
Yoasobi's debut single "Yoru ni Kakeru", which met commercial successful in Japan and worldwide in 2020, was awarded Song of the Year from the MTV Video Music Awards Japan and Space Shower Music Awards at that year, and resulted in the duo winning Best 5 New Artist at the 35th Japan Gold Disc Award. In 2021, the duo received Noma Publishing Culture Awards by Kodansha in honors of excellent contributions to publishing, regardless of its forms, as well as Artist of the Year at the 2021 MTV Video Music Awards Japan and Space Shower Music Awards and Special Achievement Award at the 63rd Japan Record Awards. Their 2021 single "Kaibutsu" won Song of the Year in both Download and Streaming categories for Japanese song at the 36th Japan Gold Disc Award and received nomination for Best Opening Sequence, along with "Yasashii Suisei" for Best Ending Sequence, at the 6th Crunchyroll Anime Awards.
Yoasobi's most successful 2023 single to date "Idol" won numerous awards, including Best Animation Video and Song of the Year at the 2023 MTV Video Music Awards Japan, Best Work and Best Anime Song Awards at the 5th Reiwa Anisong Awards, Best Anime Song at the 8th Crunchyroll Anime Awards, Special International Music Award at the 65th Japan Record Awards, Best Music at the TikTok Trend and the Yahoo! Japan Search Awards, and was nominated alongside the anime series Oshi no Ko for the U-Can New Words and Buzzword Awards. In 2025, the duo was nominated for 14 categories at the inaugural Music Awards Japan, the third most nomination following Fujii Kaze (17) and Creepy Nuts (15), which 11 were for "Idol". Finally, the duo received three awards from "Idol"–Top Global Hit from Japan, Best Anime Song, and Best Music Video. Furthermore, Yoasobi's EPs The Book, The Book 2 (both 2021), and The Book 3 were nominated for Grand Prize (Red) at the CD Shop Awards, and they won Person of the Year at the 2023 Japan PR Awards and J-pop Favorite Artist at the 2024 Melon Music Awards.
